question: 故郷
sourceMnemonic: By <kanji>circumstance</kanji> this is your <kanji>hometown</kanji>. Not much to say other than it's your <vocabulary>hometown</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>birthplace</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.

While <ja>こきょう</ja> is the more common reading for this word, it can also be read as <ja>ふるさと</ja>, which is a native Japanese word that originally didn't have kanji. <ja>ふるさと</ja> is also common in hiragana.
